pages.text: The helm takes a $(item)$(l:modules/navigation/helm#maplike)map-like item$()$() and steers the boat towards the next waypoint on this item.

The $(underline)Edit path$() button opens the $(l:others/path_editor)Path Editor menu$(), to edit the waypoints represented by the item.$(br2)$(underline)Save on map$() is available only when you have a $(item)Map$() inside the helm. Clicking the button will convert the map to a $(l:modules/navigation/helm#map_with_path)Map with Path$() item, which stores the waypoint on the item directly.

pages.title: Map-like items
pages.text: Moar Boats support multiple item types to allow you to define and store paths.

pages.title: Map
pages.text: Using a regular $(item)Map$() stores the path inside the boat.$(br2)Removing the item from the boat $(underline)will LOSE$() the path.

pages.title: Map with Path
pages.text: Contrary to $(item)Maps$(), Maps with Path store the path inside the item. That means the item can be removed from the boat, stored for later reuse and be reused later without losing its path.

pages.title: Golden ticket
pages.text: Golden tickets cannot be edited with the Helm menu, but only with the $(l:blocks/mapping_table)Mapping Table$().$(br2)Golden tickets can be copied, and copies will be synchronized with the original ticket: modifying waypoints on a Golden Ticket will modify the waypoints of all copies of that Golden Ticket.

pages.title: Golden Ticket groups
pages.text: $(br2)Multiple groups of Golden Tickets can exist at once, and tickets inside the same group share the same 'UUID'.
